detaileddescription.para: Start transfer from external flash memory to internal RAM.
Start transfer from internal RAM to external flash memory.
Start external flash memory erase operation.

briefdescription.para: QSPI tasks.

detaileddescription.para: QSPI peripheral is ready after it executes any task.

briefdescription.para: QSPI events.
QSPI interrupts.
QSPI base clock frequency divider values.
Interface configuration for a read operation.
Interface configuration for a write operation.
Interface configuration for addressing mode.
QSPI SPI mode. Polarization and phase configuration.
Addressing configuration mode.
Erasing data length.
Custom instruction length.
Function for activating the specified QSPI task.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Task to be activated.

briefdescription.para: Function for getting the address of the specified QSPI task register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
QSPI task.

simplesect.para: Address of the specified task register.

briefdescription.para: Function for clearing the specified QSPI event.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Event to be cleared.

briefdescription.para: Function for retrieving the state of the QSPI event.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Event to be checked.
The event has been generated.
The event has not been generated.

briefdescription.para: Function for getting the address of the specified QSPI event register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
The specified event.

simplesect.para: Address of the specified event register.

briefdescription.para: Function for enabling specified interrupts.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Mask of interrupts to be enabled. Use nrf_qspi_int_mask_t values for bit masking.

briefdescription.para: Function for disabling specified interrupts.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Mask of interrupts to be disabled. Use nrf_qspi_int_mask_t values for bit masking.

briefdescription.para: Function for checking if the specified interrupts are enabled.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Mask of interrupts to be checked. Use nrf_qspi_int_mask_t values for bit masking.

briefdescription.para: Function for enabling the QSPI peripheral.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.

briefdescription.para: Function for disabling the QSPI peripheral.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.

briefdescription.para: Function for configuring QSPI pins.

detaileddescription.para: If a given signal is not needed, pass the NRF_QSPI_PIN_NOT_CONNECTED value instead of its pin number.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Pointer to the pins configuration structure. See nrf_qspi_pins_t.

briefdescription.para: Function for getting the currently configured QSPI pins.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Pointer to the pins configuration structure to be filled with QSPI pins.

briefdescription.para: Function for setting the QSPI XIPOFFSET register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Address offset in the external memory for Execute in Place operation.

briefdescription.para: Function for setting the QSPI IFCONFIG0 register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Pointer to the QSPI protocol interface configuration structure. See nrf_qspi_prot_conf_t.

briefdescription.para: Function for setting the explicit value of the QSPI IFCONFIG0 register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Register value to be set.

briefdescription.para: Function for getting the explicit value of the QSPI IFCONFIG0 register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.

briefdescription.para: Function for setting the QSPI IFCONFIG1 register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Pointer to the QSPI physical interface configuration structure. See nrf_qspi_phy_conf_t.

briefdescription.para: Function for setting the QSPI ADDRCONF register.

detaileddescription.para: This function must be executed before sending task NRF_QSPI_TASK_ACTIVATE. Data stored in the structure is sent during the start of the peripheral. Remember that the reset instruction can set addressing mode to default in the memory device. If memory reset is necessary before configuring the addressing mode, use custom instruction feature instead of this function. Case with reset: Enable the peripheral without setting ADDRCONF register, send reset instructions using a custom instruction feature (reset enable and then reset), set proper addressing mode using the custom instruction feature.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Pointer to the addressing mode configuration structure. See nrf_qspi_addrconfig_conf_t.

memberdef.argsstring: (NRF_QSPI_Type *p_reg, void const *p_buffer, uint32_t length, uint32_t dest_addr)
memberdef.name: nrf_qspi_write_buffer_set

briefdescription.para: Function for setting write data into the peripheral register (without starting the process).

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Pointer to the writing buffer.
Lenght of the writing data.
Address in memory to write to.

briefdescription.para: Function for setting read data into the peripheral register (without starting the process).

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Pointer to the reading buffer.
Length of the read data.
Address in memory to read from.

briefdescription.para: Function for setting erase data into the peripheral register (without starting the process).

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Start address to erase. Address must have padding set to 4 bytes.
Size of erasing area.

briefdescription.para: Function for getting the currently configured erase pointer.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.

briefdescription.para: Function for getting the currently configured erase length.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.

briefdescription.para: Function for getting the peripheral status register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.

briefdescription.para: Function for getting the device status register stored in the peripheral status register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.

briefdescription.para: Function for checking if the peripheral is busy or not.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
The QSPI is busy.
The QSPI is ready.

briefdescription.para: Function for setting registers sending with custom instruction transmission.

detaileddescription.para: This function can be ommited when using NRF_QSPI_CINSTR_LEN_1B as the length argument (sending only opcode without data).

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Length of the custom instruction data.
Pointer to the data to send with the custom instruction.

briefdescription.para: Function for getting data from register after custom instruction transmission.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Length of the custom instruction data.
Pointer to the reading buffer.

briefdescription.para: Function for sending custom instruction to external memory.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Pointer to the custom instruction configuration structure. See nrf_qspi_cinstr_conf_t.

briefdescription.para: Function for starting a custom instruction long transfer.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Pointer to the custom instruction configuration structure. See nrf_qspi_cinstr_conf_t.

briefdescription.para: Function for checking whether a custom instruction long transfer is ongoing.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Custom instruction long transfer is ongoing.
Custom instruction long transfer is not ongoing.

briefdescription.para: Function for continuing a custom instruction long transfer.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Length of the custom instruction data.
True if the custom instruction long transfer is to be finalized. False if the custom instruction long transfer is to be continued.

briefdescription.para: Function for enabling or disabling Execute in Place (XIP) operation.

simplesect.para: XIP can be enabled after reset. See Product Specification.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
True if XIP is to be enabled, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Function for configuring the XIP encryption.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Pointer to encryption configuration structure.

briefdescription.para: Function for enabling or disabling the XIP encryption.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
True if XIP encryption is to be enabled, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Function for configuring the EasyDMA encryption.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Pointer to encryption configuration structure.

briefdescription.para: Function for enabling or disabling the EasyDMA encryption.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
True if EasyDMA encryption is to be enabled, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Function for setting the timing related to sampling of the input serial data.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure of registers of the peripheral.
Number of 64 MHz cycles (15.625 ns) delay from the the rising edge of the clock until the input serial data is sampled.

briefdescription.para: Symbol indicating whether XIP can be explicitly enabled or disabled via XIPEN register.
Symbol indicating whether encryption for XIP is present.
Symbol indicating whether encryption for EasyDMA is present.
Symbol indicating whether support for QSPI mode 1 is present.
Value representing QSPI base clock frequency.
This value can be used as a parameter for the nrf_qspi_pins_set function to specify that a given QSPI signal (SCK, CSN, IO0, IO1, IO2, or IO3) will not be connected to a physical pin.
Macro for setting proper values to pin registers.
Hardware access layer for managing the QSPI peripheral.
